snippet: With new technology, fans watching on television and following on the Internet will be able to see how fast and far players are running, as well as other statistics and data-driven graphics.
abstract: National Football League continues efforts to document and produce data-driven statistics on games with almost half teams in league installing radio receivers in stadiums and tracking devices on players; devices allow fans and teams to examine minute details of play for analysis.
lead_paragraph: With new technology, fans watching on television and following on the Internet will be able to see how fast and far players are running, as well as other statistics and data-driven graphics.

headline.main: In a Data-Driven N.F.L., the Pings May Soon Outstrip the X’s and O’s
